org.openimaj.video

Class VideoDisplay.BasicVideoTimeKeeper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.VideoDisplay.BasicVideoTimeKeeper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, org.openimaj.time.TimeKeeper<org.openimaj.time.Timecode>
    Enclosing class:
    VideoDisplay<T extends Image<?,T>>

    public class VideoDisplay.BasicVideoTimeKeeper
extends Object
implements org.openimaj.time.TimeKeeper<org.openimaj.time.Timecode>
    A timekeeper for videos without audio - uses the system time to keep track of where in a video a video should be. Also used for live videos that are to be displayed at a given rate.
    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • setTimeOffset

        public void setTimeOffset(long timeOffset)
        Set the time offset to use in the current time calculation. Can be used to force the time keeper to start at a different point in time.
        Parameters:
        timeOffset - the new time offset.
